'Play' was a Swedish pop girl group, consisting of, in total, seven young women.
Faye Hamlin, Anna Sundstrand, AnaÃ¯s Lameche, and Rosanna "Rosie" Munter formed
Play's original line-up from the band's formation from 2001 until late 2003.
After founding member Faye left the group, fifth member Janet Leon joined Play
to fill Hamlin's position as lead singer. [http://replay.waybackmachine.org/20040701005236/http://play-
central.com/ "Best-Selling Swedish Pop Quartet Play Welcomes New Member Janet
Leon"], play-central.com via archive.org. Retrieved 2011-03-14. In 2005,
the group officially announced an "indefinite break" and split up. [http://replay.waybackmachine.org/20070522171208/http://play-
mania.com/lettersfromplay/ "* :: A Letter from PLAY :: *"], 2005-09-29.
Retrieved 2011-03-19. Four years later, in 2009, the group reformed with a
new line up of three members consisting of AnaÃ¯s, Faye, and the sixth and oldest
member of Play, Sanne Karlsson. In February 2011, an official statement was made
that Faye had once again left the group and would be replaced by Emelie
Norenberg. [http://play-mania.com/2011/02/07/play-welcomes-emelie-
norenberg/ "Play Welcomes Emelie Norenberg"], Retrieved 2011-03-14. It was
announced in May 2011 that the band had separated for the second and final time.
